message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SY 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes an adaptive method to improve the convergence of stochastic gradient Langevin dynamics (SGLD) for deep networks. Additionally, the paper conducts experiments on well-known model architectures to show the effectiveness of the proposed method, which is a common practice in the machine learning community. 

The paper also involves the use of adaptive methods based on higher order curvature information, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Furthermore, the experiments conducted in the paper involve model architectures commonly used in computer vision, such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

Finally, the paper proposes a method to improve the convergence of a stochastic process, which could also suggest that it belongs to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
